pullRequest.body:
Some assorted properties of the simplex category and simplicial sets.

Co-Authored-By: Emily Riehl <eriehl@jhu.edu>
Co-Authored-By: Pietro Monticone <38562595+pitmonticone@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-Authored-By: JoÃ«l Riou <37772949+joelriou@users.noreply.github.com> 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* Prerequisite for #16784.

| Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet | 792 | 798 | +6 (+0.76%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>6 files</summary> `Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Hilbert90` `Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Resolution` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SingularSet` `Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.Basic` `Mathlib.RepresentationTheory.GroupCohomology.LowDegree` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.ExtraDegeneracy`</details>|3|
|<details><summary>17 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.EquivalencePseudoabelian` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.SplitSimplicialObject` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Homotopies` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.GammaCompN` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.EquivalenceAdditive` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.HomotopyEquivalence` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Normalized` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Faces` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Equivalence` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Decomposition` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.PInfty` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.FunctorGamma` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.NCompGamma` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.FunctorN` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.NReflectsIso` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Degeneracies` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Projections`</details>|4|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet.Monoidal` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialCategory.SimplicialObject` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialCategory.Basic`</details>|5|
|<details><summary>7 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialSet` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.Quasicategory` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.DoldKan.Notations` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.Nerve` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.AlternatingFaceMapComplex` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.MooreComplex` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.KanComplex`</details>|6|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.CechNerve` `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Idempotents.SimplicialObject` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialObject` `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SplitSimplicialObject`</details>|9|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Fin.hom_succ`
`+ Hom.ext`
`+ Truncated.uliftFunctor`
`+ castSucc_le_succ`
`+ const_fac_thru_zero`
`+ eq_const_of_zero`
`+ eq_const_to_zero`
`+ eq_of_one_to_one`
`+ eq_of_one_to_two`
`+ exists_eq_const_of_zero`
`+ inclusion.fullyFaithful`
`+ mkOfLe`
`+ mkOfLeComp`
`+ mkOfSucc`
`++ Truncated.cosk`
`++ Truncated.sk`
`++ cosk`
`++ cosk.faithful`
`++ cosk.full`
`++ cosk.fullyFaithful`
`++ coskAdj`
`++ coskAdj.reflective`
`++ cosk_reflective`
`++ sk.faithful`
`++ sk.full`
`++ sk.fullyFaithful`
`++ skAdj`
`++ skAdj.coreflective`
`++ sk_coreflective`
`+++ truncation`
`++--- sk`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
@joelriou I added the versions of co/skeleton for simplicial objects as requested under the most general hypotheses. Let me know if you'd like me to implement this differently.

I've implemented all @joelriou's suggestions and moved the adjunction stuff to the simplicial objects file. I would have written a comment at the start of the adjunctions section there but kept getting errors when I tried to insert a comment near the start of the section or near the declaration of the variables, so there's no section-wide commenting. Perhaps that's deliberate?

> I've implemented all @joelriou's suggestions and moved the adjunction stuff to the simplicial objects file. I would have written a comment at the start of the adjunctions section there but kept getting errors when I tried to insert a comment near the start of the section or near the declaration of the variables, so there's no section-wide commenting. Perhaps that's deliberate?

Did you use the `/- -/` syntax (which should work?) or `/-- -/`?
If you want to insert a comment that shall appear in the documentation, you could use `/-! -/`.

> > I've implemented all @joelriou's suggestions and moved the adjunction stuff to the simplicial objects file. I would have written a comment at the start of the adjunctions section there but kept getting errors when I tried to insert a comment near the start of the section or near the declaration of the variables, so there's no section-wide commenting. Perhaps that's deliberate?
> 
> Did you use the `/- -/` syntax (which should work?) or `/-- -/`? If you want to insert a comment that shall appear in the documentation, you could use `/-! -/`.

I had used `/-- -/` which was my mistake. I've now added comments with `/- -/`. 

I noticed also that I had accidentally constructed `skAdj` and `coskAdj` under the hypothesis of pointwise Kan extensions existing, when all that is needed is that the (not necessarily pointwise) Kan extensions do, so I fixed that.

Thanks!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11258250188/job/31304402961)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11258250188/job/31304403334)
Maybe `exists_eq_const_of_zero`, rather than just a prime?
Good suggestion, thanks.

```suggestion
/-- The adjunction between the n-skeleton and n-truncation.-/
```
Just to reflect the left/rightness.
Belongs in some file about `Fin`?

@semorrison I couldn't for the life of me figure out where the category structure on Fin is discussed. My best guess is that it's this file? I agree, this doesn't feel like the most natural location. The thing we actually need is on line 242.

But this lemma has nothing to do with the category structure. It is just an inequality, so should go in Mathlib.Data.Fin.Basic (or even earlier; I'm happy to move this to the core repository). It should also be renamed `Fin.castSucc_le_succ` as I think it's ambiguous otherwise.
Ah sorry. Now I understand the point you were making. Yes please move it wherever it belongs and rename appropriately.
@kim-em this was fixed by @digama0
I would very much prefer if these abbreviations were not introduced because I find them extremely confusing.
Cut.
Done.
As I am suggesting removing the abbreviation `Î.Î¹`, I would suggest introducing definitions (or abbreviations) for the (co)skeleton functors.

I'm aware of two conventions in the literature, where 
(i) `skeleton := lan (Î.Î¹ n).op` and where 
(ii) `skeleton := truncation.{u} n >>> lan (Î.Î¹ n).op`.

For the purposes of defining this adjunction, it might be useful to use definition (i) but I suspect definition (ii) would be more useful to folks interacting with simplicial sets in Mathlib. Thus my instinct is to adopt convention (ii) and just get rid of the abbreviation here (and above) as you suggest. Do you agree?

```suggestion
abbrev sk (n : â) : SSet â¥¤ SSet := truncation.{u} n â Truncated.sk n
```
Good idea. Just swapped the order of the definitions and implemented this.

```suggestion
protected abbrev Truncated.sk (n : â) [â (F : (SimplexCategory.Truncated n)áµáµ â¥¤ C),
```

```suggestion
protected abbrev Truncated.cosk (n : â) [â (F : (SimplexCategory.Truncated n)áµáµ â¥¤ C),
```

```suggestion
abbrev sk (n : â) [â (F : (SimplexCategory.Truncated n)áµáµ â¥¤ C),
```

```suggestion
abbrev cosk (n : â) [â (F : (SimplexCategory.Truncated n)áµáµ â¥¤ C),
```
Here, it would be slightly better to use `SimplicialObject.truncation`, and make it an abbrev?
Done.

These two definitions, and probably most of the other which appear below could be done for general simplicial objects (under suitable assumptions). Then, we should just check that the instances are found in the case of simplicial sets.
Good suggestion, thanks. And indeed lean was able to refer the existence of pointwise Kan extensions.

The parentheses are not necessary here:
```suggestion
instance cosk_reflective : IsIso (coskAdj (C := C) n).counit :=
```
There are a few more similare cases just below and in `SimplicialSet.lean`.

```suggestion

```

```suggestion

```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicTopology/SimplicialSet): SimplicialSet (co)skeleton properties

source.title: feat(AlgebraicTopology/NerveAdjunction): nerve adjunction, Cat has colimits
